section: IV - Think tanks, research and academic institutions
goals__remit:
The Directive 2009/128/EC obliged the Member States to ensure that all Pesticide Application Equipment (PAE) in professional use shall be subject to inspections at regular intervals till 26th November 2016. SPISE  
(Standardized Procedure for the Inspection of Sprayers in Europe) is a voluntary working group established during the first SPISE workshop in 2004. The participants welcomed the thought that a working group should work on further steps for the harmonization and mutual recognition of inspections of PAE. The goal in the meantime is to achieve a common  
procedure for risk assessment, quality management procedures, training courses for inspectors and supporting the  
implementation of a guideline for uniform interpretation/use of the related standards, inspection of brand new sprayers,  
development of guidelines where no harmonized standard is available at the moment and guideline for adjustment of PAE.
relevant_communication:
Up to now the SPISE Working Group organized 6 workshops (Braunschweig DE, Straelen DE, Brno CZ,  
Lana IT, Montpellier FR, Barcelona ES). Each time about 100 experts from inspection and research institutes, administration and private companies attended in the three-days-workshops. For each workshop conference  
proceedings have been published. These and further relevant documents are published also on the  
SPISE website:  http://spise.julius-kuehn.de. The next SPISE Workshop will be at Athens Septmber 26 - 28
